intro: Gagea davlianidzeae, commonly known as the Davlianidze's gagea, is a rare flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Georgia. It belongs to the Liliaceae family and is characterized by its delicate, grass-like foliage and small, bell-shaped flowers. The plant typically blooms in early spring, producing clusters of white or pale pink flowers. It thrives in well-drained, sandy soils and is often found in rocky, open habitats. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a species of conservation concern.
